segments.text: I have some tour dates to tell you about.
I'll be in Las Vegas, Nevada over Labor Day weekend.
If you're going to be there, then I will too.
I'll be in Bend, Oregon, Spokane, Washington, Portland, Oregon, Vancouver in the Canada,
Oklahoma City, North Little Rock, Springfield, Missouri, Kansas City, Missouri, Sioux Falls,
La Crosse, Green Bay, Moline, Lafayette, Louisiana, and Beaumont, Texas.
All tickets through TheoVon.com slash T-O-U-R and thank you so much for your support.
I can't thank you enough.
You know, my ninth grade civics teacher, Barbara Olinger, would be tickled to know that one
of her students is getting to sit down with a president today.
So I just want to speak her name.
She taught me to care about our country, and I still do.
Today's guest is the 45th president of the United States of America, and he's currently
running for president on the Republican ticket.
He's been an entrepreneur, a businessman, a television personality.
We sat down at his club in Bedminster, New Jersey, and we want to thank the crew there
for helping us make the production happen.
He's one of the most famous people on earth, and I'm grateful for this chance to learn more
about the man behind the headlines.
Today's guest is Donald Trump.
But your thing is going really great.
My son's a big fan of yours, Barron.
Really, Barron is?
He just graduated high school, right?
That's right.
He just did.
He knows you very well.
He said, dad, he's big.
You're a big one.
That's cool.
That's where it is nowadays, right?
Yeah.
Well, it's interesting.

And I started in my kitchen, and then yet it's evolved out of there.
That's fantastic.
I mean, it's pretty unbelievable.
What does Barron play?
Do you want to start?
You go ahead.

Are we rolling?

We're good.

He has.

He's smart.
Smart guy.
Which one of, yeah, like which one of your kids?
Like, yeah, what's something you admire about each one of your sons?
Well, Don is a hunter.
He's a great, great hunter and knows everything about that world and guns.

realize that 130 yards is actually very close in that parlance.

a very disturbed guy, but he wasn't a bad shooter.
And Eric, likewise, he loves the business.
He loves real estate.
Also, very much of a hunter and understands a lot of things about that.

and he would take them hunting in Czechoslovakia.

A lot of people.

With your dad, they would go?
No, grandfather.
Actually, they had a grandfather who was a wonderful outdoorsman and athlete.

and they'd go hunting and lots of things, and they loved it.
They got to love it.

the first time I was nervous, I think.

it's fun to kind of cut up with a little bit.

I must have been very young.

or would you think it was drugs?

sometimes our systems aren't ready to handle

just like, it wouldn't have been neat

it's real easy not to drink it.
